byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Siamak Namazi, Iranian-American businessman held in Iran for over year, is sentenced to 10 years in prison on charges of collaborating with American government; five other defendants are convicted and given similar sentences; judgement draws international outcry.

headline.print_headline: Tehran Sentences Iranian-Americans to 10 Years in Prison, Prosecutor Says
headline.main: Tehran Sentences Iranian-American Businessman to 10 Years, Report Says

snippet: Siamak Namazi, who has been held in Iran for a year, was given the prison term for collaborating with a foreign government, the Mizan news agency said....
lead_paragraph: Siamak Namazi, who has been held in Iran for a year, was given the prison term for collaborating with a foreign government, the Mizan news agency said.
